Lastly, Irena Greifová and Josef Laufer are expected to end their marriage on Thursday, 2022-12-22.

Additionally, Félix Torres, a footballer born in 1997, became a member of the Ecuador national football team, marking a significant development for the team just a few days ago.

Roman Yuzepchuk also bid farewell to FC Shakhtyor Soligorsk. In contrast, Liam Fraser began a new chapter, starting his membership with the Canada men's national soccer team on the same day.
On December 1st, 2022, several footballers parted ways with their respective teams. Lee Dong-jun, a notable footballer, ended his membership with Hertha BSC, while Anton Bahdanaw's tenure with FC Rogachev came to a close. Meanwhile, Evgheni Oancea was no longer a member of CS Concordia Chiajna, and Bohdan Myshenko's time at FC Lviv drew to a close, all on the same day, marking a significant shuffle in the football world.

Similarly, Bobur Abdikholikov parted ways with FC Energetik-BGU Minsk, while Dmitry Antilevsky's time at FC Dinamo Tbilisi also drew to a close. Meanwhile, Ivan Veras was no longer a member of United Victory, marking the end of his stint with the team, all on the same day, December 1st, 2022.
On December 1st, 2022, several footballers parted ways with their respective teams. Júlio César, a footballer born in 1996, ended his membership with FC Vitebsk, while Dmitry Bessmertny's tenure with FC BATE Borisov came to a close. Meanwhile, Marko Obradović and Oleg Pliyev also bid farewell to their teams, FK Spartak Subotica and FC Energetik-BGU Minsk, respectively, marking the end of their memberships on the same day, December 1st, 2022, which was a Thursday.

Hakim Ziyech, Badr Benoun, Ahmed Reda Tagnaouti, and Yahia Attiyat Allah were all recipients of this esteemed award, marking a significant achievement in their respective careers. The awards were conferred on the same day, with the exact timing coinciding on Tuesday, December 20th, 2022, highlighting a momentous occasion for these distinguished individuals.

Conversely, Michele Berasi embarked on a new chapter, joining Iseo– Rime– Carnovali as the team looks to make a strong impression in the upcoming season.

Meanwhile, Antoine Duchesne bid farewell to Groupama– FDJ, and Tobias Svarre concluded his tenure with Roskilde Junior, all on the same day, marking a significant reshuffling in the cycling world.

Additionally, Oskar Rønn embarked on a new journey as a member of Team Sparekassen Danmark Talent, starting his membership on January 1st, 2022.

Additionally, the International Institute for Asian Studies will become a member of the Consortium of Humanities Centers and Institutes, while the Research Council Of Lithuania will join Science Europe, all effective Saturday, January 1st, 2022.
Tue, 2022-01-04: Multiple Institutions Join Library Coalition and Research OrganizationOn January 1st, 2022, the University of Texas at Austin started being a member of the Texas Library Coalition For United Action. The same day, the University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio and Texas A& M University– San Antonio also joined the Texas Library Coalition For United Action. Additionally, the Dutch Research Council began its membership with Science Europe on January 1st, 2022.
On Saturday, January 1st, 2022, several institutions joined prominent organizations, marking a new year of collaboration and cooperation. Sam Houston State University and the University of North Texas Health Science Center both became members of the Texas Library Coalition For United Action, effective January 1st, 2022. Meanwhile, Texas State University also started its membership with the Texas Library Coalition For United Action on the same day. Across the globe, the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences began its membership with the Association Of Academies And Societies Of Sciences In Asia, further expanding international academic ties as of January 1st, 2022.

On the same day, the Association of American University Presses joined the National Coalition For History, expanding its reach in advocacy efforts.

The University of Colorado Boulder, the Enoch Pratt Free Library, and the University of Nebraska–Lincoln all began their membership on this day, bringing a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the alliance. Additionally, the renowned New York Philharmonic also started its membership, highlighting the diverse range of organizations committed to the alliance's mission.

On January 1st, 2022, a significant expansion of international academic collaborations was marked as several prestigious institutions joined prominent global organizations. The Rwanda Academy Of Sciences and the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus, as well as Academia De Ciencias De La República Dominicana, all commenced their membership with the InterAcademy Partnership. Meanwhile, the Hungarian Academy of Sciences began its affiliation with the International Science Council, further solidifying its presence on the global stage. These new memberships underscore the growing importance of cooperative efforts in advancing scientific knowledge and understanding worldwide.

Sunday, January 2nd, 2022: Local Research Project Loses FundingA local research project, whose details have not been disclosed, has lost its sponsorship from the German Research Foundation, effective January 1st, 2022, as confirmed by records dated January 1st, 2022, Sat, 2022-01-01, 2022-01-01, and Sat, January 1st, 2022, marking the end of the foundation's support, as the subject entity is no longer sponsored by the object entity.
On Saturday, January 1st, 2022, the German Research Foundation ended its sponsorship of several research projects. The projects, including "Funktionen Und Molekulare Mechanismen Der Ap-1 Und Ap-2 Komplexe Und Ihrer Untereinheiten" and "Die Molekulare Funktion Von Tbx18 In Der Ureterentwicklung", were no longer receiving funding from the foundation as of this date. Additionally, two unnamed projects also lost sponsorship from the German Research Foundation on the same day, January 1st, 2022.
On January 1st, 2022, several research projects lost a key backer as the German Research Foundation ended its sponsorship. This included the project "Plattformen Für Chemische Genetik Zum Studium Der Pflanzenbiologie", which had been exploring the application of chemical genetics to plant biology. Another affected project was "Spezifitätsanalyse Von Humanen Protein Lysin-Methyltransferasen Und Proteomweite Identifizierung Neuer Substratproteine", focused on the analysis of human protein lysin-methyltransferases. The archaeological excavation "Die Unterstadt Von Bogazköy-Hattusa" also saw its funding from the German Research Foundation come to an end on this day.
On January 1st, 2022, several research projects lost their sponsorship. The German Research Foundation ended its support for two projects: 'Festlegung Der Entwurfswerte Der Schneelasten Auf Satteldächern Auf Der Grundlage Einer Wahrscheinlichkeitstheoretischen Modellierung' and 'Biochemische Charakterisierung Und Regulatorische Eigenschaften Der Zusammenlagerungsmaschinerie Für U Snrnps', as well as an unnamed project. Meanwhile, the Lower Saxony Ministry Of Science And Culture also ceased sponsoring the 'Wissens-Aggregator Mittelalter Und Frühe Neuzeit ( Wiag) ' project on the same day.

In a significant development, several prominent institutions joined the Digital Research Alliance Of Canada on January 1st, 2022. Polytechnique Montréal, HEC Montréal, St. Joseph's Healthcare Hamilton, and the University of Ottawa all commenced their membership on this day, marking a major expansion of the alliance. While the exact timing of the memberships may have been formalized at slightly different moments, with some institutions finalizing their agreements on Saturday, January 1st, 2022, and others on the same date expressed as 2022-01-01, the collective impact is clear: these four entities are now officially part of the Digital Research Alliance Of Canada.

Emily Carr University of Art and Design and Red Deer Polytechnic, both based in Canada, became members of the Digital Research Alliance Of Canada, while Memorial University of Newfoundland also joined the same alliance on the same day. Meanwhile, in the United States, Ohio History Connection started its membership with the American Association for State and Local History, marking a new chapter in its commitment to preserving history.
